poem:
"Elegy for Gery"

Language music-maker, 
Brittle yet unbroken at a century-and-three,
Browsed life's braille, made sense of every note,
Backstage maestra of the symphony.

Labour's voice in London, 
Kept time in council chambers and copyrights,
Ambassador in the trade of tongues,
Tuned the world's orchestra into equal rights.

Adieu, Gery, Decca duchess,
Your melody in our memory abides.
